meanings.definition: To cry out loudly or vehemently.
meanings.sent1: She was outcrying for help when she got lost in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The child started outcrying when he couldn't find his favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was outcrying for treats, wagging its tail eagerly.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to be outcrying its fury upon the town.
meanings.sent5: The singer's powerful voice outcried all others in the competition.

meanings.sent1: The outcrying of the protesters echoed through the streets.
meanings.sent2: The outcrying of the baby could be heard from the next room.
meanings.sent3: The outcrying of the seagulls disrupted the peaceful beach day.
meanings.sent4: The outcrying of the fans filled the stadium with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The outcrying of the alarm alerted everyone to the danger.
